message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.DC 

Reasoning: The paper deals with the theory and construction of locally repairable codes, which are used in distributed data storage. This topic falls under the intersection of several sub-fields of computer science, including information theory (cs.IT), data structures (cs.DS), coding theory (cs.CC), systems and control (cs.SI), and distributed computing (cs.DC). The paper uses matroid theory to derive bounds on the performance of LRCs, which suggests a strong connection to the sub-field of combinatorial optimization (cs.DS). Overall, the paper is likely to be classified under cs.IT, but could also be relevant to several other sub-categories.
